results.name: Numerator of (n+1)*Bernoulli(n).
comment: The denominators are in A050932. The e.g.f. for (n+1)*Bernoulli(n), n >= 0, is (d/dx)(x^2/(exp(x)-1)) = x*(2*(exp(x)-1)- x*exp(x))/(exp(x)-1)^2. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jul 15 2013

It can be observed that the rational sequence [0, 1, 1, 1/2, 0, -1/6, 0, 1/6, 0, -3/10, 0, 5/6, ...], derived from a(n)/A050932(n), is an autosequence of the first kind. - _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 21 2017
Apparently a(n) = numerator(Sum_{k=0..n-1} (-1)^(n-k+1)*E1(n,k+1)/binomial(n,k+1)) for n >= 2, where E1(n, k) denotes the first-order Eulerian numbers A123125. - _Peter Luschny_, Feb 17 2021
